conbody.p: Netlify is an easy to use way of connecting to a GitHub account containing DITA XML content, building the content whenever changes are detected and then hosting the content. The Oxygen XML Blog has a Gradle build file which can be invoked from a Netlify account to automatically build and published WebHelp and PDF outputs of the blog content. The problem with Netlify is that it has support only for Java 8 while the latest Oxygen Publishing Engine now requires Java 17 and later.
